channel.title: Authors on Development Data Partnership
channel.description: Recent content in Authors on Development Data Partnership

item.description: Cristina Nolasco, Innovation & Outreach Consultant, IDB Lab
Julien Collaer, Data Scientist, IDB Lab
Niccolò Comini is an Economist in the Chief Economist’s Office of the Infrastructure Vice Presidency at the World Bank Group.
Robert C. M. Beyer, Senior Economist, World Bank
Johanna Belanger, Consultant, World Bank
Walker Kosmidou-Bradley is a Geographer in the World Bank’s Poverty and Inequality Global Practice.
Laura Ralston, Senior Economist, World Bank
Maksim Pecherskiy, Data Engineer (Development Data Partnership), World Bank
Mykhailo Koltsov, Consultant, World Bank
Niccolò Comini is an Economist in the Chief Economist’s Office of the Infrastructure Vice Presidency at the World Bank Group.
Dieter Wang, Consultant, World Bank
Rajee Kanagavel, Development Data Partnership
Afeefah Khazi-Syed, Consultant, GGSCE, World Bank
Gabriel Stefanini Vicente, Data Scientist, Development Data Partnership
Holly Krambeck, Senior Economist, World Bank and founder, Development Data Partnership
Jacques Morisset is the World Bank Lead Economist and Program Leader for Vietnam.

Kai Kaiser has been Senior Economist with the World Bank in Hanoi, Vietnam since early 2016, where his engagement has focused primarily on issues of public finance and public sector governance reform.
Maham Faisal Khan is a Data Scientist at the Global Facility for Disaster Relief and Recovery (GFDRR) and the Vietnam COVID-19 Big Data Observatory (https://covid-19observatory.
Nicholas Jones is a Data Scientist in the Global Facility for Disaster Reduction and Recovery (GFDRR), where he focuses on climate resilient development.
Bruno Sanchez-Andrade Nuno _Lead Data Science Advisor, Development Data Partnership
Omari Sefu, Associate Research Manager, Facebook
Sreelakshmi Papineni is an economist working at the Gender Innovation Lab, within the World Bank’s Africa Chief Economist Office.
Fatima Arroyo-Arroyo works in the Transport Global Practice, supporting the transportation agenda in Africa.
